text.text: Bill Gates PREDICTED The Coronavirus In 2015

- Today the greatest risk of global catastrophe doesn't look like this. Instead it looks like this. If anything kills over 10 million people, in the next few decades, it's most likely to be a highly infectious virus rather than a war. Now, part of the reason for this is that we have invested a huge amount in nuclear deterrents. But we've actually invested very little in a system to stop an epidemic.
We're not ready for the next epidemic. The failure to prepare could allow the next epidemic to be dramatically more devastating than Ebola. The best lessons I think on how to get prepared are again what we do for war. We need a Medical Reserve Corps, lots of people who've got the training and background, who are ready to go with the expertise. And then we need to pair those medical people with the military. Taking advantage of the military's ability to move fast through logistics and secure areas. We need to do simulations.
Germ games not war games. So that we see where the holes are. Finally, we need lots of advanced R and D in areas of vaccines and diagnostics. There are some big breakthroughs like adeno-associated virus that could work very, very quickly. Now I don't have an exact budget for what this would cost, but I'm quite sure it's very modest compared to the potential harm.
The World Bank estimates that if have a worldwide flu epidemic, global wealth will go down by over $3 trillion, and we'd have millions and millions of deaths. If we start now we can be ready for the next epidemic. 
Thank you (audience applauding) (logo whooshing) So this is a serious problem, we should be concerned.

text.text: Ingliz-tilidagi 15 ta eng mashhur sleng  qisqartmalar
1. Ain't = Am not/are not/is not - emas

text: E.g. I ain't sure - ishonchim komil emas
E.g. He ain't finished yet - u tugatmagan hali
E.g. I wanna go home. - men uyga ketishni xohlayman
E.g. I wanna coffee. - xohlayman bitta kofe

text.text: 5. Whatcha = What are you - sen nima

text: E.g. Whatcha gonna do? - sen nima qilmoqchisan?
E.g. What kinda movie is that? - U qanaqa kino
E.g. Iâ€™m sorta tired - men sal charchadim
E.g. Get outta here - bu yerdan tashqariga chiq
E.g. I eat alotta cake. - men ko'p to'rt yeyman
E.g. I have lotsa money - menda ko'p pul bor
E.g. Much of  was wasted - vaqtning ko'pi bekor ketdi
E.g. Would you like a cuppa coffee? - bir chashka kofe xohlaysizmi?
E.g. Lemme see! - ruhsatingi bilan ko'raychi
E.g. Gimme the pen! - ruchkani menga ber

text.text:
means you can enjoy two different opportunities at the same time.
â€œBy working part-time and looking after her kids two days a week she managed to get the best of both worlds.â€

this means that the person youâ€™re just talking about actually appears at that moment.
â€œHi Tom, speak of the devil, I was just telling Sara about your new car.â€

this means agreeing with someone.
â€œThey finally saw eye to eye on the business deal.â€

an event that happens infrequently.
â€œI only go to the cinema once in a blue moon.â€

something that will never happen.
â€œWhen pigs fly sheâ€™ll tidy up her room.â€
To cost an arm and a legâ€™

something is very expensive.
â€œFuel these days costs and arm and a leg.â€

something is very easy.
â€œThe English test was a piece of cake.â€
Let the cat out of the bagâ€™Â â€“

to accidentally reveal a secret.
â€œI let the cat out of the bag about their wedding plans.â€

to not feel well.
â€œIâ€™m really feeling under the weather today; I have a terrible cold.â€
To kill two birds with one stone

to solve two problems at once.
â€œBy taking my dad on holiday, I killed two birds with one stone. I got to go away but also spend time with him.â€

to do something badly or cheaply.
â€œThey really cut corners when they built this bathroom; the shower is leaking.â€

â€“ to make a situation worse.
â€œTo add insult to injury the car drove off without stopping after knocking me off my bike.â€
You canâ€™t judge a book by its coverâ€™

to not judge someone or something based solely on appearance.
â€œI thought this no-brand bread would be horrible; turns out you canâ€™t judge a book by its cover.â€

Â means â€˜good luckâ€™ (often said to actors before they go on stage).
â€œBreak a leg Sam, Iâ€™m sure your performance will be great.â€
To hit the nail on the headâ€™

to describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.
â€œHe hit the nail on the head when he said this company needs more HR support.â€

text_entities.text:
means you can enjoy two different opportunities at the same time.
â€œBy working part-time and looking after her kids two days a week she managed to get the best of both worlds.â€

this means that the person youâ€™re just talking about actually appears at that moment.
â€œHi Tom, speak of the devil, I was just telling Sara about your new car.â€

this means agreeing with someone.
â€œThey finally saw eye to eye on the business deal.â€

an event that happens infrequently.
â€œI only go to the cinema once in a blue moon.â€

something that will never happen.
â€œWhen pigs fly sheâ€™ll tidy up her room.â€
To cost an arm and a legâ€™

something is very expensive.
â€œFuel these days costs and arm and a leg.â€

something is very easy.
â€œThe English test was a piece of cake.â€
Let the cat out of the bagâ€™Â â€“

to accidentally reveal a secret.
â€œI let the cat out of the bag about their wedding plans.â€

to not feel well.
â€œIâ€™m really feeling under the weather today; I have a terrible cold.â€
To kill two birds with one stone

to solve two problems at once.
â€œBy taking my dad on holiday, I killed two birds with one stone. I got to go away but also spend time with him.â€

to do something badly or cheaply.
â€œThey really cut corners when they built this bathroom; the shower is leaking.â€

â€“ to make a situation worse.
â€œTo add insult to injury the car drove off without stopping after knocking me off my bike.â€
You canâ€™t judge a book by its coverâ€™

to not judge someone or something based solely on appearance.
â€œI thought this no-brand bread would be horrible; turns out you canâ€™t judge a book by its cover.â€

Â means â€˜good luckâ€™ (often said to actors before they go on stage).
â€œBreak a leg Sam, Iâ€™m sure your performance will be great.â€
To hit the nail on the headâ€™

to describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.
â€œHe hit the nail on the head when he said this company needs more HR support.â€

text.text: Garvard Universiteti talabalarini doimo ruhlantiruvchi 15 ta

text:
qoidasi :

1. Agar hozir uxlasangiz, orzuyingiz tushingizda namoyon bo'ladi. Agarkim uyqu o'rniga darslarni qilishni tanlasangiz, orzuyingiz amalda sodir bo'ladi.Â 
2. Agar biror ishni qilishga kech bo'ldi deb o'ylasangiz, bilingkim aslida hali juda erta.Â 
3. O'qish-o'rganish azobi vaqtinchalik. Uquvsizlik azobi bir umrlik.Â 
4. Dars qilish bu qanchadir vaqt sarflash emas, dars qilish bu mashaqqat va harakatdir.Â 
5. Hayot faqatgina dars qilishdan iborat emas, lekin agarkim shugina mashaqqatni yenga olmasangiz, o'zi aslida nimaga qodirsiz?
6. Zo'r g'ayrat va tirishqoqlik rohatlanishga yetaklaydi.Â 
7. Kimki hamma ishni oldindan mashaqqat va harakat sarflab bajarsa, faqatgina o'sha inson muvaffaqiyatdan rohatlanishi mumkin.Â 
8. Hamma narsaga ulgurish qobiliyati hammaga ham berilavermaydi. Lekin omad faqat kamolotga erishish va qatiyatlilik bilan keladi.Â 
9. Vaqt shavqatsiz, u hech qachon sizni kutmaydi.Â 
10. Bugun nimagadir havasingiz ketgan so'laklar, ertaga ko'z yoshingizga aylanishi mumkin.Â 
11. Odamlar kimki kelajak uchun investitsiya qiladiganlar - haqiqiy realistlardir
12. Sizning ishlab topayotgan mablag'ingiz sizning qanchalik yaxshi ta'lim olganiz bilan to'g'ridan-to'g'ri bog'liqdir.
13. Bugun hech qachon qaytib kelmaydi va hech qachon takrorlanmaydi.
14. Hattoki hozir shu maqolani o'qiyotgan paytingizda ham, sizni dushmanlaringiz kitob varaqlab o'z ustilarida ishlayaptilar.Â 
15. Terlamasang, pul topolmaysan

text.text:
Bularni hammasini bir joyga to'plash,sizlar uchun ulashish bu Juda ham ajoyib ish!

CollectorğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ“ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» : Saydullo AbdupattayeV

So'z boyligimizni oshiramiz
ğŸš© Predlogli birikmalar


ğŸ’¥ After all = ga qaramasdan
ğŸ’¥ All along = har doim
ğŸ’¥ All of a sudden = to'satdan
ğŸ’¥ All the same = bir xil
ğŸ’¥ Angry with = achchiqlanmoq
ğŸ’¥ As a rule = odatda 
ğŸ’¥ As far as I am concerned = mening fikrimcha
ğŸ’¥ As for me = meni o'ylashimcha
ğŸ’¥ Be about to = tayyor bo'lmoq
ğŸ’¥ Be back on ones feet = healthy again or better financially 
ğŸ’¥ Be beside oneself = juda havotirlangan, achchiqlangan 
ğŸ’¥ Be in the red = qarzga botmoq
ğŸ’¥ Bored by = charchagan bo'lmoq
ğŸ’¥ Capable of = ga qobilyatli bo'lmoq
ğŸ’¥ Confused by = yanglishmoq
ğŸ’¥ Come across = to'satdan ko'rib qolmoq
ğŸ’¥ Catch ones eye = e'tiborini tortmoq
ğŸ’¥ Dressed in = kiyinib olgan
ğŸ’¥ Disappointed by = dan norozi bo'lmoq
ğŸ’¥ Fed up with = joniga tegmoq
ğŸ’¥ Famous for = mashxur
ğŸ’¥ Frightened by =qo'rqmoq
ğŸ’¥ Envious of = ichi qoralik qilmoq
ğŸ’¥ Exhausted from = charchagan, horigan

messages.author: Temur Sobirov
text:
â€‹â€‹English tests 

Fill in the blanks with an appropriate preposition or adverb particle.

1. The woman broke â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.in the middle of her speech.

 a) up b) in c) down d) off

2. Can you blow â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ the candle?

 a) off b) on c) out d) up

3. At last the storm blew â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..

 a) off b) over c) out d) in

4. The opposition parties brought â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.. a No-Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister.

 a) up b) forward c) out d) about

5. The accused said that he canâ€™t call â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ the whole events.

 a) up (recollect) b) in c) on d) at

6. The employees have called â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. the strike.

 a) off b) on c) at d) in

7. The investigators tried to call â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.. the necessary information from the family of the victim.

 a) off b) forth c) up d) out

8. The terroristâ€™s plan to blow â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ the bridge was foiled by police.

a) out b) off c) up d) over

text:
enough va too so'zlarining sifat va ravishlar bilan qo'llanishi

âœ³ï¸ enough - yetarli(cha) degan ma'noda qoÊ»llaniladi va qaysi soÊ»z turkumi bilan qoÊ»llanilishiga qarab gapdagi joyi oÊ»zgaradi.
â–ªï¸adjective and adverb+ enough  
â–ªï¸enough+ noun

âœ³ï¸ Yuqoridagi qurilmadan ham bilsa boÊ»ladiki, enough soÊ»zi sifat va ravishlardan keyin, otlardan oldin keladi.
ğŸ”¸I can't run very far. I am not fit enough. (Men juda uzoqqa yugurolmayman. Men yetarlicha sog'lom emasman...sifat+enough)
ğŸ”¸Let's go. We have waited long enough. (Ketdik. Biz yetarlicha uzoq kutdik...ravish+enough)
ğŸ”¸I can't run very far. I haven't got enough energy. (Men juda uzoqqa yugurolmayman. Menda yetarlicha kuch yoÊ»q...enough+ot)

âœ³ï¸ too- juda, o'ta degan ma'noda sifat va ravishlardan oldin kelib, ularning ma'nosini kuchaytiradi.
ğŸ”¸You never stop working. You work too hard. (Siz hech qachon ishlashni toÊ»xtatmaysiz. Siz juda qattiq ishlaysiz...too+ravish)
ğŸ”¸I can't understand him. He speaks too quickly. (Men uni tushuna olmayman. U juda tez gapiradi...too+ravish)

âœ…Qiyoshlash uchun:
ğŸ”¸He speaks very quickly. (...juda tez gapiradi, lekin tushunsa boÊ»ladi)
ğŸ”¸He speaks too quickly. (...juda tez gapiradi, tushunib boÊ»lmaydi.)

âœ³ï¸ too many/too much iboralari otlar oldidan juda koÊ»p degan ma'noni bildirib keladi.
ğŸ”¸There is too much furniture in this room. There isn't enough space. (juda ko'p mebel, too much+sanalmaydigan ot)
ğŸ”¸There were too many people and not enough chairs. (juda ko'p odam, too many+sanaladigan ko'plikdagi ot)

âœ… too va not...enough soÊ»zlarini gaplarda qiyoslaymiz. Ular odatda bir-biriga antonim ma'no beradi.
ğŸ”¸You never stop working. You work too hard. (yetarlidan ortiq qattiq ishlaysiz.)
ğŸ”¸You are lazy. You don't work hard enough. (yetarlicha qattiq ishlamaysiz)

âš ï¸ enough soÊ»zi yolg'iz oÊ»zi oldin tilga olingan otni takrorlamaslik uchun ham qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸We don't need any more money. We have got enough. (=enough money)

âœ³ï¸ Quyidagi qurilmalarga e'tibor bering:
â–ªï¸enough/too...for somebody/something
ğŸ”¸We haven't got enough money for a holiday. (ta'til uchun)
ğŸ”¸Is Joe experienced enough for the job?
ğŸ”¸This shirt is too big for me. I need a smaller size.
â–ªï¸enough/too...to do something
ğŸ”¸We haven't got enough money to go on holiday. (ta'tilga ketish uchun)
ğŸ”¸Is Joe experienced enough to do the job?
ğŸ”¸They are too young to get married.
ğŸ”¸They are not old enough to get married.

âš ï¸ Quyidagi misollarda too va enough soÊ»zlarining infinitiv bilan qoÊ»llanishiga e'tibor bering.
ğŸ”¸These boxes are too heavy to carry. (...to carry them emas)
ğŸ”¸This chair is not strong enough to stand on. (to stand on it emas)

Gollandiyada oâ€˜qish uchun stipendiya dasturi
ğŸ¢ Hanze Universiteti
ğŸ“ Magistratura

text.text:
â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Story of my life
Searching for the right
But it keeps avoiding me
Sorrow in my soul
Cause it seems that wrong
Really loves my company

He's more than a man
And this is more than love
The reason that the sky is blue
The clouds are rolling in
Because I'm gone again
And to him I just can't be true

And I know that he knows I'm unfaithful
And it kills him inside
To know that I am happy with some other guy
I can see him dying

I don't wanna do this anymore
I don't wanna be the reason why
Every time I walk out the door
I see him die a little more inside
I don't wanna hurt him anymore
I don't wanna take away his life
I don't wanna be
A murderer

As I'm doing my hair
Preparing for another date
A kiss upon my cheek
As he reluctantly
Asks if I'm gonna be out late
I say I won't be long
Just hanging with the girls
A lie I didn't have to tell
Because we both know

And we know it very well

Get it over with
I don't wanna do this
Anymore

I don't wanna be the reason why
And every time I walk out the door
I see him die a little more inside

I don't wanna be

Yeah yeah yeah yeah

I'm fourteen carat

Now you say I got a touch
So good, so good
Make you never wanna leave
So don't, so don't

Gonna wear that dress you like, skin-tight
Do my hair up real, real nice
And syncopate my skin to your heart beating

'Cause I just wanna look good for you, good for you
I just wanna look good for you, good for you
Let me show you how proud I am to be yours
Leave this dress a mess on the floor
And still look good for you, good for you

I'm on my marquise diamonds
I'm a marquise diamond
Could even make that Tiffany jealous

So bad, so bad

text:
1. Agar inson o'zidan qoniqmasa, hayotdan qoniqmaydi.

2. Yosh faqat sizning ongingizda. Agar siz bu haqda o'ylamasangiz, u mavjud emas.

3. Insoniyat chindan ham kuchli qurolga ega va bu kulgidir.

4. G'azab - bu saqlanadigan idishga zarar yetkazadigan kislota bo'lib, u quyiladi.

5. Dunyo bo'ylab hamma sizga qarzdorligini e'lon qilmang. Dunyo hech narsadan qarzdor emas. U sizdan oldin ham mavjud bo'lgan.

text:
as+sifat/ravish+as qurilmasining ishlatilishi

âœ³ï¸ as soÊ»zi -dek degan ma'nosida juft holda qoÊ»llanilib, sifat va ravishlarni qiyoshlash uchun ham qoÊ»llaniladi. Bunday hollarda sifat va ravishlar oÊ»zlarining oddiy darajasida qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸The chair is as expensive as the table. (Kursi stoldek qimmat.)
ğŸ”¸A Fiat costs as much as a Citroen. (Fiat Sitroendek narxda)

âœ³ï¸ Inkor gaplarda bu qurilmaning qiyoslash ma'nosi yaqqol koÊ»rinadi.
ğŸ”¸Richard isn't as old as he looks. (Richard ko'ringanidek qari emas)
ğŸ”¸I don't know as many people as you do.
ğŸ”¸How much did it cost? Fifty pounds?  No, not as much as that.
ğŸ”¸We can't do crosswords as quickly as you do. (Biz krosvordlarni sizdek tez yecholmaymiz ... siz tezroq yechasiz degan ma'noda)

âœ³ï¸ Inkor gaplarda birinchi as oÊ»rniga so soÊ»zini qoÊ»llashimiz ham mumkin.
ğŸ”¸It's cold, but it isn't so cold as yesterday.

âœ³ï¸ asâ€¦as qurilmasining ustunligi - bu sifat (ravish) belgisining qancha barobar (twice/three times...) farq qilishini ham bildira olishidir. Boshqa qurilmalar bunday imkoniyatga ega emas.
ğŸ”¸A Ferrari costs $400 000. A Fiat  costs $200 000.     
â–So a Ferrari costs twice as much as a Fiat. (...ikki barobar qimmat.)
ğŸ”¸Their house is three times as big as ours. (...uch marta katta.)

âš ï¸ Bu qurilmada as â€¦ as orasida sifat yoki ravishni oddiy darajasi kelishi va than soÊ»zi qatnashmasiligini esda saqlash lozim.
ğŸ”¸Our  house is as big than yours. (xato)  
ğŸ”¸Our house is as bigger as yours. (xato)     
ğŸ”¸Our  house is as big  as yours. (toÊ»g'ri)

âœ³ï¸ the same +noun+as  qurilmasini ham esdan chiqarmaslik lozim. Mazkur qurilma ot bilan ishlatilsa ham, qiyoslash ma'nosini bera oladi.  
ğŸ”¸Tom  is the same age as Jill. (= Tom is as old as Jill)
ğŸ”¸George lives in the same street as Liz.

âœ³ï¸ Qiyosiy darajaning yana bir shakli bu sifat va ravishlar oldidagi more soÊ»z oÊ»rniga less soÊ»zini qoÊ»yib qoÊ»llashdir. Bunday hollarda less soÊ»zi biror xususiyat otda kamroq ekanligi koÊ»rsatiladi. O'zbek tiliga tarjima qilinganda, ingliz tilida ishlatilgan sifat (ravish)ning antonimi bilan tarjima qilinadi.
ğŸ”¸This chair is less comfortable than that one. (Bu kursi narigisiga qaraganda noqulayroq)
ğŸ”¸A Ferrari costs  $400 000,  a Fiat costs $200 000.  
â–So, a Fiat is less expensive than a Ferrari. (arzonroq)

text.text:
If you donâ€™t love yourself, nobody will. Not only that, you wonâ€™t be good at loving anyone else. Loving starts with the self.

Agar o'zingizni sevmasangiz, hech kim buni qilmaydi.  Bundan tashqari, siz boshqalarni yaxshi ko'rolmaysiz.  Sevgi o'zidan boshlanadi.

G'oliblar har xil ishlarni qilishmaydi, ular boshqacha yo'l tutishadi.

ğŸ“Œ give somebody a smile 
ğŸ“š tabassum qilmoq 
ğŸ–Š The boy gave a friendly smile. 

ğŸ“Œ flash somebody a smile 
ğŸ“š tez, ozgina kulib qo'ymoq 
ğŸ–Š Jane flashed him a smile. 

ğŸ“Œ be all smiles 
ğŸ“š xursandchilikdan mazza qilib kulmoq
ğŸ–Š One moment he's all smiles, the next moment he shouts at me. 

ğŸ“Œ wear a smile 
ğŸ“š yuzini tabassum qoplamoq 
ğŸ–Š Opened the door, she wore a smile. 

ğŸ“Œ somebody's smile broadens 
ğŸ“š ochilib kula boshladi 
ğŸ–Š As soon as he see his baby, his smile broadens.

messages.text: Nima uchun studentlar sessiyadan oâ€™tishaolmaydi? Bir yilda 365 kun bor. Ulardan 52 kuni yakshanba. 313 kun ilm olish uchun. Yozgi tatil ortacha 85 kun. Bizda 228 kun dars tayyorlashga qoldi. Har kunlik 8 soatlik uyqu 122 kun degani. Bizda 106 kun qoldi. Har bir kishi 1 kunda kamida 1 soat dam olishi kerak va bu 15 kunni anglatadi. 91 kun qoldi. 2 soat ovqatlanish uchun ajratishga majbursiz va bu bir yilning 30 kunini egallaydi. Bizda 61 kun qoldi. Gaplashish insonga xos tushuncha va bu bir kunda bir kishidan kamida 1 soatni talab qilsa 1 yilda 15 kun demak. Atiga 46 kun ilm uchun. Bayramlar, kutilmagan xursandchiliklar va koâ€™ngilsizliklar 40 kunni har bir kishidan band qilar ekan. 6 kun qoldi. Issiq jonni istimasi bor deyishganidek, hammamiz bir yilda kamida 3 kun kasal bolsak. Nahotki kinoga tushish, odnoklassnikiga oâ€™tirish, uchrashuvlarga bir yilda 2 kun ajratmasak qanaqa odammiz. Ha atiga 1 kun qoldi. Oâ€™sha bir kun meni tugilgan kunim-ku. Tugilgan kunimda dars qilishga balo bormi

text:
Siz uchun qadrli boâ€™lgan qizni koâ€™rganingizda albatta tabassum qiling. Yuzingizdagi tabassum, sizni hotirjam va yoqimli inson qilib koâ€™rsatadi. Undan keyin bu tabassum orqali "Tosh yurakâ€ qizlarni ham bir oz eritish mumkin. Tabassumingiz â€“ oâ€™sha qizga nisbatan ijobiy fikrdaligingizni bildiradi.

2.ğŸ‘•

Kiygan kiyimingiz oâ€™zingizga yarashgan va tartibli boâ€™lishi kerak. Dazmollangan koâ€™ylak va shimda siz yanada xushbichim koâ€™rinasiz. Yana bir muhim narsa â€“ sizning oyoq kiyimingiz. Uning qandayligi ayol uchun juda muhim, shuning uchun oyoq kiyimingiz doimo toza, zamonaviy va tartibli boâ€™lishi lozim.

3.ğŸ’ª

Sogâ€™lom koâ€™rinish ayollarning diqqatini tortadi. Siz lapshaygan va shalpaygan holda u qizni oldida tursangiz, bu degani siz u qizni yoâ€™qotdingiz. Gavdangizni tik tuting. Boshingizni koâ€™taring, yelkangiz bukchaymasin.

4.ğŸ“

.
 Ayollar aqlli va dono yigitlarni hurmat qilishadi va qadrlaydi. Uni oldida har sohada oâ€™tkir ekanligingizni namoyon qila oling. Uning bergan savollariga donolik bilan javob qaytaring.

5.ğŸ’¬

Har qanday mavzuda suhbatlashib keta olish qobiliyatingizni rivojlantiring. Muhokama qilinayotgan mavzuga eng yaxshi fikrni siz bering. Qizlar har sohada faol yigitlarni yoqtirishadi. Buning uchun nima qilish kerak? Atrofdagi yangiliklarga qiziqing, ularni kuzating, koâ€™proq kitob oâ€™qing.

6.ğŸš«

Yaâ€™ni birovlarga taqlid qilmang. Siz boshqalarga oâ€™xshamaganligingiz uchun ham sizga qiziqishsin.

7.ğŸ¤¨

Qizlarga har narsaga va har gapga tirjayaveradigan yigitlar umuman yoqmaydi. Qiz bolaga faqat uning atrofida boâ€™layotgan, unda boshqa qizga bir ogâ€™iz gapirmaydigan va nazar tashlamaydigan yigitlar yoqadi.

8. ğŸ‘

Qizbola maqtovni suyadi. Uning tashqi koâ€™rinishidagi kichik bir oâ€™zgarishni ham shundoq oâ€™tkazib yubormang. Albatta kompliment qiling, xatto may-chuyda narsalariga ham eâ€™tiborli boâ€™ling. "Bugungi soch turmagingiz sizga juda yarashibdi. Koâ€™ylagingizni rangini aytmasam ham boâ€™ladi. Juda ham goâ€™zalsiz bugun.â€ Bu gapingizga qiz bola eâ€™tiroz bildirsa ham, ich-ichidan juda suyunadi.

9.ğŸ

Unga kutmaganda kutilmagan sovgâ€™alar qilib turing. U katta sovgâ€™a boâ€™lishi shart emas. Asosiysi sovgâ€™a â€“ bu eâ€™tibor berayotganingizdan darak beradi.

10. âœŠ

.
Qizlar mujimal, bir gapini eplab aytolmaydigan yigitlarni umuman yoqtirmaydi. Ular dadil, oâ€™z gaplariga ishonch bilan gapiradigan va sevgisini ham choâ€™zib yurmasdan shartta aytadigan yigitlarni xurmat qiladi.

11.ğŸ˜

Kamtar bo'ling, boyligingiz bilan maqtanmang. Eng asosiysi to'gri so'z bo'ling!

text:
O'n beshta dono fikr.

1.Borini qadriga yetmagunimizcha, istaganimzga erisha olmaymiz.

2.Agar siz ketsangiz-u, ortingizdan hech kim chaqirmasa, demak siz toâ€˜gâ€˜ri yoâ€˜ldasiz.

3.Odamlardan yiroqlashishni istasangiz suv boâ€˜yiga boring; U eshitadi va tinchlantiradi.

4.Siz hotirjamlik bilan qabul qiladigan muammolar boshqa sizni bezovta qila olmaydi.

5.Unutmang! Siz izlayotgan narsa, sizni ham izlayotgan boâ€˜ladi.

6.Istasangiz yetarli nur, istamasangiz qorongâ€˜ulik koâ€˜rinaveradi.

7.Oâ€˜zlikni topish mumkin emas; Odam oâ€˜zini oâ€˜zi yaratdi.

8.Yerda yashash qimmat, biroq bir yil davomida quyosh atrofida sayohat qilish bepul ekanligini unutmang.

9.Bugungi kunni almashtirish yoki qaytarib berish mumkin emas.

10.Oâ€˜zingizga yaxshi joyni izlashda maâ€™no yoâ€˜q; Maâ€™no istalgan yerda yaxshi joy yaratishda.

11.Agar sizning atrofingizda hech kim qolmagan boâ€˜lsa; U holda oâ€˜zingiz bilan tanishish fursati yetib kelgan.

12.Uyga kelasiz va oâ€˜rindiqqa oâ€˜tirasiz â€“ atrofda tinchlik; Buni kimdir yolgâ€˜izlik deydi, boshqalar esa erkinlik.

13.Butun dunyoga oâ€˜zingizda bor boâ€˜lgan eng yaxshi narsalarni bering; Va sizga dunyodagi eng yaxshi narsalar taqdim etiladi.

14.Agar muammoni pul hal etsa, u holda bu muammo emas â€“ chiqim.

15.Bugun hal qildim, bugun yaxshi kun; Nega bugun yaxshi kun ekanligini faqat hali hal qilmadim...!!!

Yaqinlaringizga ham ulashing!

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§Biz Â«forÂ» soâ€™zini Â«uchunÂ» degan tarjimadan tashqari,Â â€˜becauseâ€™ â€“ Â«chunkiÂ» tarjimasini keltirib chiqarish uchun ham ishlatishimiz mumkin.Â For soâ€™zi bu tarjima bilan faqat rasmiy ingliz tilida ishlatiladi.
The divers have to be carefulÂ forÂ a sudden change in conditions could be dangerous â€“ Haydovchilar ehtiyot boâ€™lishlari kerak,Â chunkiÂ holatdagi keskin oâ€™zgarish xavfli boâ€™lishi mumkin.

Read the instructions carefullyÂ forÂ you will only get one chance to enter the information â€“ Yoâ€™riqnomani diqqat bilan oâ€™qing,Â chunkiÂ maâ€™lumotni kiritish uchun faqat bitta imkoniyatga ega boâ€™lasiz.

ğŸ”¹Bundan tashqariÂ forÂ soâ€™zini maqsad yoki sababga nisbatan ishlatishimiz ham mumkin.

What is that for? â€“ Bu nima uchun?

Thank you for your letter. â€“ Maktubingiz uchun raxmat.

I donâ€™t have enough money for the ticket. â€“ Menda chipta uchun yetarli pul yoâ€™q.

You need to stand up for what is right. â€“ Haqiqat uchun kurashishingiz kerak.

ğŸ”¹BizÂ forÂ soâ€™zini vaqt va masofani bildiruvchi iboralar bilan ishlatishimiz mumkin.

I walked for miles. â€“ MenÂ milyalab yurdim.

I waited for a long time. â€“ Men uzoq vaqt kutdim.

We will be away for the next week. â€“ Biz kelasi hafta davomida ketgan boâ€™lamiz.

ğŸ”¹Baâ€™zan yuqoridagiga oâ€™xshash maâ€™nolardaÂ forÂ soâ€™zini butunlay tushirib qoldirishimiz ham mumkin. Bunda, gap maâ€™nosida hech qanday oâ€™zgarish boâ€™lmaydi:

text:
-ing yoki -ed bilan tugaydigan sifatlar

âœ³ï¸ hozirgi  va oÊ»tgan zamon sifatdoshi haqida soÊ»z borgan edi. Mazkur mavzuda esa -ing yoki -ed qoÊ»shimchalari bilan tugaydigan sifatlar haqida ma'lumot olasiz. 
âœ³ï¸ Bu sifatlar har doim otni izohlab undan oldin keladi.
ğŸ”¸It is a very interesting story.
âœ³ï¸ Yoki bog'lovchi fe'llardan (linking verbs) (to be/to look/to smell) keyin ishlatilib, predmet yoki shaxsning belgisini bildiradi.
ğŸ”¸Ann looks tired. She has been working hard all day.

âœ³ï¸ -ing yoki -ed bilan tugaydigan sifatlarning umumiy bir xususiyati boÊ»lib, unga koÊ»ra -ing bilan tugaydigan sifatlar predmetlarning belgisini bildirish uchun, -ed bilan tugaydigan sifatlar shaxslarning belgisini bildirish uchun qoÊ»llaniladi. Masalan:
ğŸ”¸Jane is bored because her job is boring. (Jane zerikkan, chunki uning ishi zerikarli)
ğŸ”¸I am interested in this job because it is interesting. (Men bu ishga qiziqayapman, chunki uqiziqarli)

âœ³ï¸ Eng keng tarqalgan -ing yoki -ed qoÊ»shimchalari bilan tugaydigan juft sifatlar quyidagilardan iborat.
âœ… interesting - qiziqarli â¡ï¸ interested - qiziqqan
âœ… confusing - chalkash â¡ï¸ confused - chalkashib ketgan
âœ… boring - zerikarli â¡ï¸ bored - zerikkan  
âœ… embarrassing - xijolatli â¡ï¸ embarrassed  - xijolatda qolgan, uyalgan
âœ… tiring - charchatadigan â¡ï¸ tired - charchagan 
âœ… disappointing - hafsalani pir qiladigan â¡ï¸ disappointed -  hafsalasi pir boÊ»lgan
âœ… surprising - ajablanarli â¡ï¸ surprised  - ajablangan
âœ… horrifying - qoÊ»rqinchli â¡ï¸ horrified- qoÊ»rqqan
âœ… amazing - taajjublanarli â¡ï¸ amazed  - taajjubda 
âœ… terrifying - dahshatli, qoÊ»rqinchli â¡ï¸ terrified - dahshatda qolgan, qoÊ»rqqan
âœ… amusing - kulguli â¡ï¸ amused - kayfiyati choqâœ… worrying - tashvishli â¡ï¸ worried - tashvishlangan
âœ… shocking - hayratga soladigan â¡ï¸ shocked - hayratda
âœ… annoying - jig'iga tegadigan â¡ï¸ annoyed - jig'ibiyronâœ… disgusting - nafratlanarli â¡ï¸ disgusted - nafratda  
âœ… exhausting - holdan toydiradigan â¡ï¸ exhausted - holdan toygan
âœ… satisfying - qoniqarli â¡ï¸ satisfied - qoniqqan
âœ… fascinating - maftunkor â¡ï¸ fascinated - maftun boÊ»lgan
âœ… frightening - qoÊ»rqinchli â¡ï¸ frightened - qoÊ»rqqan
âœ… exciting - hayajonli â¡ï¸ excited - hayajonda

âœ³ï¸  Yuqoridagi sifatlarni umumiy qoidaga koÊ»ra -ing bilan tugaydiganlari predmetlar uchun, -ed bilan tugaydiganlari shaxslar uchun qoÊ»llanilishini bilasiz. Ammo ba'zi sifatlar (boring, interesting) shaxslarning belgisini ham bildirib kelishi mumkin.
ğŸ”¸ Our professor is very boring. I can't help sleeping at his lectures. (Bizning professorimiz juda zerikarli. Uning darslarida o'zimni uxlab qolishdan tiyolmayman)

text:
in time va on time birikmalarining farqi

1ï¸âƒ£ on time - o'z vaqtida, belgilangan vaqtda degan ma'noda ishlatiladi. Demak, bu birikma ishlatilishi uchun ish-harakat aniq vaqtga belgilangan va shu vaqtda sodir boÊ»lishi kerak.
ğŸ”¸The 11.45 train left on time. (poyezd 11.45da ketgan)
ğŸ”¸ Please be on time. Don't be late. (Iltimos, o'z vaqtida keling, kechikmang)
ğŸ”¸The conference was very well-organised. Everything began and finished on time. (Hamma narsa belgilangan vaqtida boshlanib va belgilangan vaqtda tugagan.)

2ï¸âƒ£ in time (for something/to do something) - yetarlicha erta, vaqtida ulgurib degan ma'noda ishlatiladi. Bu yerda aniq vaqt boÊ»lmaydi va kimdir biror ish qilishga ulgurishi asosiy oÊ»rinda turadi.
ğŸ”¸Will you be in time for dinner? (Kechki ovqatga ulgurasanmi?)
ğŸ”¸I must hurry. I want to get home in time to see the football match on television.

âœ… in time iborasining antonimi too late (juda kech) hisoblanadi.
ğŸ”¸I got home too late to watch the game on TV. (Men juda kech bordim - o'yinni ko'rolmadim)

âš ï¸ just in time - zoÊ»rg'a ulgurib birikmasi ishlatilishiga e'tibor bering.
ğŸ”¸A child ran across the road in front of the car, but I managed to stop just in time. (mashinamni vaqtida toÊ»xtatishga zoÊ»rg'a ulgurdim)

âš ï¸in good time - ancha oldin degan ma'noda qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸You must arrive at the airport in good time not to miss your flight.

text.text:
â€‹â€‹Nega kitob oâ€˜qiyotganda uyqu keladi? Bunga qarshi nimalar qilish mumkin?

Kitob oâ€˜qiyotganida uxlab qolmagan odam boâ€˜lmasa kerak. Garchi, kitob zerikarli boâ€˜lmasa ham. Koâ€˜pchilik kitob oâ€˜qisa, uyqusi kelib qolishidan noliydi. Britaniya psixologik jamiyatidan doktor Xristian Jarret bu jarayoni quyidagicha izohlaydi.
Odatda kitobni qulay holatda oâ€˜qishga harakat qilamiz â€“ oâ€˜tirib yoki yotib, tinch joyda, kun oxirida yoki faol mashgâ€˜ulotlardan keyin. Bularning hammasi boâ€˜shashishga olib keladi. Bundan tashqari, matn tashqi olamdan va uning tashvishlaridan chalgâ€˜itadi, muammolarni esdan chiqarib, xotirjam boâ€˜lishimizga yordam beradi. Shuningdek, fantaziya uygâ€˜onib, uyquga eltishi mumkin.

Kitobni oâ€˜qib tugatishingiz kerak boâ€˜lsa yoki uxlab qolmasdan uzoq vaqt kitob oâ€˜qishni xohlasangiz, quyidagi 8 ta usuldan foydalanganingiz maâ€™qul:

1. Â Kitob oâ€˜qish uchun qulayroq joy toping, lekin juda qulay boâ€˜lmasin. Yotoqda kitob oâ€˜qigandan koâ€˜ra, kresloga oâ€˜rnashib oling. U yerda ham uxlab qolayotgan boâ€˜lsangiz, stulda oâ€˜tirib kitob oâ€˜qing.
2. Â Kitob oâ€˜qiyotganingizda xona yorugâ€˜ligini oshiring.
3. Â Xonani shamollating, u biroz salqin boâ€˜lishi kerak. Issiq havoda tez uxlab qolasiz.Â 
4. Â Kitobni oâ€˜qib tugatishingiz zarur boâ€˜lsa, oâ€˜qishga kirishishdan oldin, tetiklashishga harakat qiling. Badantarbiya mashqlarini bajaring, qahva iching, sovuq dush qabul qiling va hokazo.Â 
5. Â Tanaffuslar qiling, â€œporsiyalarâ€ bilan oâ€˜qing. Bir soatdan ortiq davomiy kitob oâ€˜qimang. Turing va biroz qadam bosing â€“ qoningiz yurishib, tetiklashasiz.Â 
6. Â Oldingizda suv, sharbat solingan stakan yoki bir piyola choy boâ€˜lsin.
7. Â Faol oâ€˜qing â€“ iqtiboslarni belgilang, qaydlar qiling. Elektron kitobda ham iqtiboslarni belgilash diqqatingiz konsentratsiyasi uzoq vaqt saqlanishiga yordam beradi. Tana faol boâ€˜lsa (sahifalarga stikerlar yopishtirish, qalam ushlash, fikrlarni yozib qoâ€˜yishda), miya ham faollikni saqlaydi.Â 
8. Â Kitob oâ€˜qish vaqtingizni oâ€˜zgartiring. Agar har doim kechqurun uyqudan oldin kitob oâ€˜qisangiz kitob va uyquni bogâ€˜lovchi shartli refleks hosil boâ€˜ladi. Kunduzi oâ€˜qishni sinab koâ€˜ring.

â¥Bizning kanal

text.text:
ğŸ—£ Ed Sheeran
ğŸµ Perfect

[Verse 1]
I found a love for me
Darling, just dive right in and follow my lead
Well, I found a girl, beautiful and sweet
Oh, I never knew you were the someone waiting for me
'Cause we were just kids when we fell in love
Not knowing what it was
I will not give you up this time
But darling, just kiss me slow, your heart is all I own
And in your eyes, you're holding mine

[Chorus]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favourite song
When you said you looked a mess, I whispered underneath my breath
But you heard it, darling, you look perfect tonight

[Verse 2]
Well I found a woman, stronger than anyone I know
She shares my dreams, I hope that someday I'll share her home
I found a love, to carry more than just my secrets
To carry love, to carry children of our own
We are still kids, but we're so in love
Fighting against all odds
I know we'll be alright this time
Darling, just hold my hand
Be my girl, I'll be your man
I see my future in your eyes

[Chorus 2]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark, with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favorite song
When I saw you in that dress, looking so beautiful
I don't deserve this, darling, you look perfect tonight

[Instrumental]

[Chorus 3]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark, with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favorite song
I have faith in what I see
Now I know I have met an angel in person
And she looks perfect
I don't deserve this
You look perfect tonight

But darling, just kiss me slow, your heart is all I own
And in your eyes, you're holding mine

[Chorus]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favourite song
When you said you looked a mess, I whispered underneath my breath
But you heard it, darling, you look perfect tonight

[Verse 2]
Well I found a woman, stronger than anyone I know
She shares my dreams, I hope that someday I'll share her home
I found a love, to carry more than just my secrets
To carry love, to carry children of our own
We are still kids, but we're so in love
Fighting against all odds
I know we'll be alright this time
Darling, just hold my hand
Be my girl, I'll be your man
I see my future in your eyes

[Chorus 2]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark, with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favorite song
When I saw you in that dress, looking so beautiful
I don't deserve this, darling, you look perfect tonight

[Instrumental]

[Chorus 3]
Baby, I'm dancing in the dark, with you between my arms
Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favorite song
I have faith in what I see
Now I know I have met an angel in person
And she looks perfect
I don't deserve this
You look perfect tonight

messages.author: Temurbek Sobirov
text:
Kuniga oâ€˜rtacha 150 marta smartfonimizga qaraymiz: Internetdan ham uzoqlashib dam olish kerak!

Internet sohasini oâ€˜rganish bilan shugâ€˜ullanuvchi mutaxassis, mustaqil tadqiqotchi Dmitriy Solovyov internetdan vaqti-vaqti bilan dam olib turish kerakligini olgâ€˜a suradi.  Quyida raqamlar haqiqatdan â€œsoâ€˜zlaydiâ€...
Â 
20 foiz foydalanuvchilar ijtimoiy tarmoqlardan voz kechib, oâ€˜z sahifalarini yopishga qaror qilishgan

2010-yillarda internetdan uzoqlashish urfga kirgan edi. Fransuz yozuvchisi Terri Kruze internetdan yarim yilga, jurnalist Pol Miller esa butun bir yilga voz kechgan ekan. 2020-yilda bunday boâ€˜lishini tasavvur qila olasizmi? Sizga katta muhlatga internetdan uzoqlashing, demoqchi emasmiz. Bor-yoâ€˜gâ€˜i, kuniga bir necha marta faqatgina kerakli bildirishnomalarga eâ€™tibor berish odatini shakllantirishni tavsiya qilmoqchimiz. Shunda siz internetdagi ortiqcha narsalardan yiroqlashgan boâ€˜lasiz.
Â 
67 foiz odamlar telefoniga hech qanday bildirishnoma kelmagan boâ€˜lsa ham uni tinimsiz kuzatishadi

Buning asl sababchisi mikro zerikishdir. Zerikish hissi bir necha soniya yoki butun kun davomida ham kuzatilishi mumkin. Zerikdingizmi, biror bir foydali yumush bilan shugâ€˜ullanishga harakat qiling. Hadeb ijtimoiy tarmoqlarga keraksiz vaqtda ham kirib-chiqaverish, nimalarnidir oâ€˜qishga tushish sizni bora-bora yolgâ€˜izlatib, jamiyatdan alohidalanishga sababchi boâ€˜lishi mumkin.Â 
Â 
10 foiz odamlar oila davrasida oâ€˜tirgan vaqtda ham xabarlarga javob berishda davom etishadi

Raqamli etika hali toâ€˜liq shakllanib ulgurganicha yoâ€˜q. Shu sabab uni har kim oâ€˜zi istaganicha oâ€˜rnatishi mumkin. Biroq dunyodagi eng yaqin insonlaringiz â€“oila qurshovida oâ€˜tirgancha, telefon titkilash tashqaridan ham xunuk koâ€˜rinishini nazarimda, hamma yaxshi biladi.
Â 
The Center of Internet Addictionâ€™da internetdan tobelikni davolashning individual kursi 14000 dollar turadi

Bu yerda internetga qattiq bogâ€˜lanib qolgan insonlar davolanishiga ishonasizmi? Gadjetlar sabab odamlarda stress, surunkali charchoq, asabiylik tobora rivojlanib bormoqda. Raqamli stress bilan ham kurashish kerak.
Â 
65 foiz insonlar birovlar bilan suhbatlasha turib ham telefondan foydalanishadi

Suhbat vaqtida telefon titib, internetdan foydalanib oâ€˜tirish suhbatdoshga nisbatan hurmatsizlik, deb qabul qilinadi. Statistik maâ€™lumotlarga koâ€˜ra, inson qarshisida telefoniga qarab oâ€˜tirgan ikkinchi bir odamning oldida noqulaylikni his qilar ekan. Bu holatda suhbat ikki inson orasida emas, balki ikkita suhbatdosh va suhbatdoshlardan birini dialog vaqtida chalgâ€˜itib oâ€˜tirgan â€œonlayn suhbatdoshâ€ orasida boâ€˜ladi.

Buyuk Britaning 54 foiz aholisi telefonsiz qolib ketishdan qoâ€˜rqadi

Qoâ€˜rquvning bu turi nomofobiya deb ataladi. Bunday fobiyaga duchor boâ€˜lgan odamga telefonni yoâ€˜qotish oâ€˜z tashqi xotirasini, yarim bosh miyasini yoâ€˜qotishdek tuyuladi. Nomofobiyani yana onlayn yaqin insonidan ayrilishdan qoâ€˜rqish, deb ham atashadi.
Â 
Kuniga 150 marta smartfonimizga qaraymiz

Odamlar tun yarmida hojatxonaga chiqishda ham telefoniga qaraydi, undagi xabarga koâ€˜z yugurtiradi. 79 foiz insonlar ertalab uygâ€˜onishlari bilan smartfonidan foydalanishni boshlab yuborishadi. 62 foizi esa darrov ijtimoiy tarmoqlariga kiradi. Erta tongni bu holda qarshi olish toâ€˜gâ€˜ri emas. Bu sizni yalqov va dangasa qilib qoâ€˜yadi. Ushbu odatdan uzoqlashish uchun telefoningizni yotogâ€˜ingizdan uzoqda, boshqa xonada saqlang.
Â 
24 foiz insonlar hayotidagi muhim onlarni telefoniga videoga yoki suratga olishi sabab oâ€˜tkazib yuborishyapti

Onlayn tasvirga olish hayotiy muhim onlardan lazzatlanishingizga toâ€˜qsinlik qiladi. Toâ€˜gâ€˜ri, bu onlarni tarixga muxrlash kerak. Ammo butun bir jarayonni tasvirga olgancha oâ€˜tkazish notoâ€˜gâ€˜ri. Hayot lazzatlariga kamera ortidan qarashni bas qiling!

text.text: ğŸ§ KoÊ»pchiligimiz musiqa eshitib dars qilishni xush koÊ»ramiz. XoÊ»sh bu qay darajada toÊ»gÊ»ri

Olimlarimizning takidlashicha musiqaning insonga juda ham foydali taraflari koÊ»p. Masalan xotiramizni, diqqatimizni oshirish uchun foydali hisoblanadi. Bundan tashqari ogÊ»ir stress yoki shunchaki kayfiyatimiz yoÊ»q paytida bizga katta nafi tegadi. Demak dars qilish jarayonida musiqa tinglash foydali hisoblanadi.

Ammo musiqa tinglash kerak ekan deb bass ya'ni tovushlari baland musiqalarni tinglash ularni qoÊ»shilib birga kuylash notoÊ»gÊ»ri hisoblanadi. U holda sizning bor diqqatingiz musiqada boÊ»lib dars qila olmaysiz. 

Musiqadan unumli foydalanish uchun siz sokin yoki ozroq shoÊ»x musiqalarni tinglaganingiz yaxshi. Rok janridagi musiqalar sizga tavsiya etilmaydi. Shaxsan oÊ»zim tavsiya etadigan musiqalarim albatta ingliz tili dagi musiqalardir. Nega bu sizni ingliz tilidagi Listening qismini oÊ»sishiga yordam beradi. Men tavsiya etadigan qoÊ»shiqlar :

1.One Direction - Last First Kiss
2. Backstreet boys - Show me the meaning
3. Maher Zain - Paradise
4. Havana feat Yaar - I lost you

â¥Bizning kanal

text:
I had a dream
I got everything I wanted
Not what you'd think
And if I'm bein' honest
Itâ€…might'veâ€…been a nightmare
Toâ€…anyone who might care
Thought I couldâ€…fly (Fly)
So I stepped off the Golden, mm
Nobody cried (Cried, cried, cried, cried)
Nobody even noticed
I saw them standing right there
Kinda thought they might care (Might care, might care)

I had a dream
I got everything I wanted
But when I wake up, I see
You with me

And you say, "As long as I'm here, no one can hurt you
Don't wanna lie here, but you can learn to
If I could change the way that you see yourself
You wouldn't wonder why here, they don't deserve you"

But my head was underwater
They called me weak
Like I'm not just somebody's daughter

But it felt like they were right there

But I don't wanna let anybody know
'Cause everybody wants something from me now
And I don't wanna let 'em down

text.text:
â€‹â€‹ğŸ¼ â€‹â€‹"Million Years Ago"
ğŸ¤ Adele
 
I only wanted to have fun
Learning to fly learning to run
I let my heart decide the way
When I was young

Deep down I must have always known
That this would be inevitable
To earn my stripes I'd have to pay
And bare my soul

I know I'm not the only one
Who regrets the things they've done
Sometimes I just feel it's only me
Who can't stand in reflection that they see
I wish I could live a little more
Look up to the sky not just the floor
I feel like my life is flashing by
And all I can do is watch and cry

I miss the air
I miss my friends
I miss my mother
I miss it when

Life was a party to be thrown
But that was a million years ago

When I walk around all of the streets
Where I grew up and found my feet
They can't look me in the eye
It's like they scared of me

I tried to think of things to say
Like a joke or a memory
But they don't recognize me now
In the light of day.

I know I'm not the only one
Who regrets the things they've done
Sometimes I just feel it's only me
Who never became who they thought they'd be
I wish I could live a little more
Look up to the sky not just the floor
I feel like my life is flashing by
And all I can do is watch and cry

I miss the air
I miss my friends
I miss my mother
I miss it when, 

Life was a party to be thrown
But that was a million years ago

A Million Years Ago...

messages.title: Photograph

messages.from: Online English lessons and Japanese language
messages.author: Temurbek Sobirov

text.text:
Loving can hurt
Loving can hurt sometimes
But it's the only thing
That I know.
And when it gets hard
You know it can get hard sometimes
It is the only thing that makes us feel alive.
We keep this love in a photograph
We make these memories for ourselves
Where our eyes are never closing
Hearts are never broken
And time's forever frozen still.
So you can keep me
Inside the pocket
Of your ripped jeans
Holdin' me closer
Till our eyes meet
You won't ever be alone
Wait for me to come home.
Loving can heal
Loving can mend your soul
And is the only thing
That I know (know)
I swear it will get easier
Remember that with every piece of ya
And it's the only thing we take with us when we die.
We keep this love in a photograph
We make these memories for ourselves
Where our eyes are never closing
Our hearts were never broken
And time's forever frozen still.
So you can keep me
Inside the pocket
Of your ripped jeans
Holdin' me closer
Till our eyes meet
You won't ever be alone.
And if you hurt me
Well that's okay baby only words bleed
Inside these pages you just hold me
And I won't ever let you go.
Wait for me to come home
Wait for me to come home
Wait for me to come home
Wait for me to come home.
Oh you can fit me
Inside the necklace you got when you were 16
Next to your heartbeat
Where I should be
Keep it deep within your soul.
And if you hurt me
Well that's okay baby only words bleed
Inside these pages you just hold me
And I won't ever let you go.
When I'm away
I will remember how you kissed me
Under the lamppost
Back on 6th street
Hearing you whisper through the phone
Wait for me to come home.

text.text: Donald Trump accuses WHO of 'misleading' US over coronavirus

Trump: ... getting pieces already and we're not happy about it and we are by far the largest contributor to WHO, world health, and they misled us. I don't know and they must have known more than they knew because they came after what other people knew that weren't even involved.
We knew things that they didn't know and either they didn't know or they didn't tell us. You know, right now they're literally a pipe organ for China.
That's the way I view it so I'm wishing and we're looking and we're watching.
And again we give $500m and we have over the years from 400 to 500 for a long time for many years. And China is giving $38m and yet
they seemed to work for China.
And they should have been in there early they should have known what was going on and they should have been able to stop it.
You talk about stopping the spread or stopping the embers, that could have been stopped there.
And then why China allow planes to fly out but not into China?
But they allow planes to come out and planes are coming out of Wuhan and they're going all over the world. They're going to Italy very, very big time to Italy, but they're going all over the world but they're not going into China. What was that all about? So we had a ... No, you'll hear we're coming up with a very distinct recommendation but we're not happy with it.
We're not happy with it. Even today, I've heard some statements that are very positive.
There's nothing positive about what
happened in China having to do with this subject, nothing positive at all.
So we'll have a recommendation pretty soon but we are not happy with the World Health Organization, that I can tell you.

And then why China allow planes to fly out but not into China?

They're going to Italy very, very big time to Italy, but they're going all over the world but they're not going into China. What was that all about? So we had a ... There's nothing positive about what
happened in China having to do with this subject, nothing positive at all.
So we'll have a recommendation pretty soon but we are not happy with the World Health Organization, that I can tell you.

â€‹â€‹â€‹âš¡ï¸ Toshkent shahridagi Turin Politexnika universitetiga qabul boshlandi!

Aziz abituriyentlar va ota-onalar!

Sizlarga mamnuniyat bilan shuni ma'lum qilamizki, Toshkentdagi Turin Politexnika universitetiga 2020/2021 oâ€˜quv yili uchun qabul boshlandi.

Abituriyentlarni qabul qilish va universitet bitiruvchilarini attestatsiyadan oâ€˜tkazish jarayoni Italiyaning Turin Politexnika universiteti tomonidan belgilangan tartibda, Oâ€˜zbekiston Respublikasi oliy va oâ€˜rta ta'lim vazirligi bilan kelishilgan holda amalga oshiriladi.

2019/2020 oâ€˜quv yilida Toshkent shahridagi Turin politexnika universiteti bakalavriat bosqichining har bir yoâ€˜nalishi uchun belgilangan qabul kvotasi quyidagicha taqsimlanadi

ğŸ”† Ijtimoiy himoyaga muhtoj oila farzandlaridan eng iqtidorli 20 nafari universitet grantiga qabul qilinadi. 

Oâ€˜zbekiston Respublikasi  Vazirlar Mahkamasining 2020 yil 8 may VM-272-son qarori bilan Toshkent shahridagi Britaniya menejmenti universiteti tashkil etilgani haqida xabar berga edik. 

Universitet nodavlat oliy taÊ¼lim tashkiloti hisoblanib, unda oâ€˜qitish Oâ€˜zbekiston Respublikasida amalda mavjud taÊ¼lim shakllari hamda ingliz tilida toâ€˜lov-kontrakt asosida amalga oshiriladi.

Shu bilan birga har yili ijtimoiy himoyaga muhtoj oilalarning qobiliyatli, iqtidorli hamda oâ€˜zlashtirish koâ€˜rsatkichlari yuqori boâ€˜lgan farzandlari orasidan tanlov asosida bepul (Universitet granti asosida) 20 nafardan kam boâ€˜lmagan abituriyentlar oâ€˜qishga qabul qilinadi.

Universitet bitiruvchilariga Oâ€˜zbekistonda oliy maÊ¼lumot toâ€˜gâ€˜risidagi hujjat sifatida eÊ¼tirof etiladigan belgilangan namunadagi diplom beriladi.

Manba |

text.text:
SATIRIK HIKOYACHA

Bir odam musulmonlar qabristoniga itni ko'mdi.
Ko'rganlar uni ustidan qoziga shikoyat qilishdi.
Qozi odamni chaqirdi va bu ishining sababini so'radi.
Odam:
-To'g'ri, shunday qildim. Chunki menga itning vasiyati shunday edi, dedi.
Qozi:
-Sen biz bilan o'yin qilyapsanmi, deb g'azabi keldi.
Odam:
-Yo'q, qozi janoblari. It o'larkan qozi janoblariga o'n ming dirham berishimni ham vasiyat qilgandi, dedi.
Buni eshitgan qozi darrov:
-Rahmatli itning o'limi bizni juda mahzun qildi, dedi.
Insonlar qozining bu o'zgarishidan hayratda qolishdi.
Qozi:
-Siz hayron bo'lmang, bu itning o'tmishini surishtirdim, Asxabul Kahfning iti, Qitmirning avlodidan ekan.

Qozini sotib olgan kuning, adolat o'ladi,
Adolat o'lgan kuni, davlat o'ladi.

Fotih Sulton Mehmedhon

(bu yilgi bitiruvchilar uchun)

Bir biridan farq qilar yillar, 
Yigâ€˜layapman koâ€˜zlarimda yosh, 
Sogâ€˜inchlarga  toâ€˜ladi  dillar, 
Omonmisiz aziz sinfdosh. 
Vujudimni nimtalar bir oh,
Chalinmaydi soâ€˜ngi qoâ€˜ngâ€˜iroq.

Ufqlarga termulib,unsiz,
Har dam sizni yodga olaman,
Yuragimda mudom ismingiz,
Nomingizni kuyga solaman,
Umidlarim sarobdir biroq,
Chalinmaydi soâ€˜ngi qoâ€˜ngâ€˜iroq.

Yoâ€˜limizga intozor maktab,
Diydorimiz kutar mungâ€˜ayib,
Hijronlardan yaralangan qalb,

Ey aziz doâ€˜st,ey aziz oâ€˜rtoq,
Chalinmaydi soâ€˜ngi qoâ€˜ngâ€˜iroq.

Nohaq dunyo,bagâ€˜ritosh dunyo,
Tatirmidi diydorsiz yozlar,
Qadringizni bilmadik goho,
Rozi boâ€˜ling bizdan ustozlar,
Har soâ€˜zingiz bizlarga saboq,
Chalinmaydi soâ€˜ngi qoâ€˜ngâ€˜iroq.

Yangi orzu,yangi umidlar,
Chorlamoqda bugun bizlarni,
Qayda boâ€˜lmay,koâ€˜zda yosh bilan,

Qayda boâ€˜lsang omon boâ€˜l har choq,
Chalinmaydi soâ€˜ngi qoâ€˜ngâ€˜iroq.

text.text:
Qabul-2020: Fanlar majmuasidagi asosiy oâ€˜zgarishlar

1. Oâ€˜zbek filologiyasi yoâ€˜nalishida ikkinchi fan â€“ chet tili

Yangi tasdiqlangan fanlar majmuasida Â«5120112: Filologiya va tillarni oâ€˜qitish (tillar boâ€˜yicha)Â» yoâ€˜nalishi boâ€˜yicha ona tili va adabiyot hamda chet tili fanlaridan imtihon olinishi belgilangan.

Â«Biroq negadir roâ€˜yxatda 2019-2020 oâ€˜quv yili uchun fanlar majmuasida koâ€˜rsatilgan Â«5120101: Filologiya va tillarni oâ€˜qitish: oâ€˜zbek tiliÂ» yoâ€˜nalishi va unga qaysi fanlardan imtihon olinishi koâ€˜rsatilmagan.

Shu sababli oâ€˜zbek filologiyasi yoâ€˜nalishida oâ€˜qishni xohlagan abituriyentlar qaysi fanlardan imtihon topshirishni bilishmayapti. Ona tili va adabiyotdan tashqari ikkinchi fan tarixmi yoki chet tili?Â» â€“ deb yozadi samarqandlik oâ€˜qituvchi Samgin Qurbonov.

DTM matbuot xizmati maÊ¼lumotiga koâ€˜ra, Â«5120112: Filologiya va tillarni oâ€˜qitishÂ» taÊ¼lim yoâ€˜nalishlarining barchasida yoâ€˜nalishga mos fanlar sifatida ona tili va adabiyot hamda chet tili fanlari tasdiqlangan.

Nafaqat Â«Filologiya va tillarni oâ€˜qitishÂ», balki Â«Xorijiy til va adabiyotiÂ», Â«Tarjima nazariyasi va amaliyotiÂ» kabi taÊ¼lim yoâ€˜nalishlarining barchasi tillar boâ€˜yicha bitta guruhga birlashtirilgan.

2. Tarix yoâ€˜nalishida ikkinchi fan â€“ geografiya

Bu yil tarix yoâ€˜nalishlari uchun tarix va geografiya fanlaridan imtihon olinadi. Avvallari bu yoâ€˜nalishga kirishdagi ikkinchi fan ona tili va adabiyot edi.

3. Toshkent davlat yuridik universiteti, yurisprudensiya yoâ€˜nalishi

TDYUUga kirish uchun fanlar majmuasi 2019 yilgacha tarix (3.1 ball), ona tili va adabiyot (2.1), chet tili (1.1) ketma-ketligida, 2019 yili esa ona tili va adabiyot (3.1 ball), chet tili (2.1), tarix (1.1) etib belgilangan edi.

2020 yildan esa mazkur universitet uchun ham boshqa OTMlarning yurisprudensiya yoâ€˜nalishlari kabi tarix va chet tilidan test olinishi belgilangan.

4. Turizm yoâ€˜nalishi

Â«5610300: Turizm (faoliyat yoâ€˜nalishlari boâ€˜yicha)Â» yoâ€˜nalishida ham oâ€˜zgartirish kiritilgan boâ€˜lib, endilikda turizm sohasida oâ€˜qimoqchi boâ€˜lgan abituriyentlar chet tili va tarix fanlaridan imtihon topshirishadi.

Lekin turizmga oid boshqa yoâ€˜nalishlarda, masalan, Â«Turizm sohasida marketingÂ», Â«Turizm sohasida logistikaÂ» kabi qator yoâ€˜nalishlar uchun chet tili va matematika fanlaridan imtihon qoâ€˜yilgan.

Manba |

text.text:
ğŸ¤ Adele
ğŸ¼ "HELLO"

Hello, it's me
I was wondering if after all these years you'd like to meet
To go over everything
They say that time's supposed to heal ya
But I ain't done much healing
Hello, can you hear me
I'm in California dreaming about who we used to be
When we were younger and free
I've forgotten how it felt before the world fell at our feet
There's such a difference between us
And a million miles
Hello from the other side
I must have called a thousand times
To tell you I'm sorry for everything that I've done
But when I call you never seem to be home
Hello from the outside
At least I can say that I've tried
To tell you I'm sorry for breaking your heart
But it don't matter it clearly doesn't tear you apart anymore
Hello, how are you?
It's so typical of me to talk about myself I'm sorry
I hope that you're well
Did you ever make it out of that town where nothing ever happened
It's no secret that the both of us
Are running out of time
So hello from the other side
I must have called a thousand times
To tell you I'm sorry for everything that I've done
But when I call you never seem to be home
Hello from the outside
At least I can say that I've tried
To tell you I'm sorry for breaking your heart
But it don't matter it clearly doesn't tear you apart anymore
Ooooohh, anymore
Ooooohh, anymore
Ooooohh, anymore
Anymore
Hello from the other side
I must have called a thousand times
To tell you I'm sorry for everything that I've done
But when I call you never seem to be home
Hello from the outside
At least I can say that I've tried
To tell you I'm sorry for breaking your heart
But it don't matter it clearly doesn't tear you apart anymore

text:
Kuniga oâ€˜rtacha 150 marta smartfonimizga qaraymiz: Internetdan ham uzoqlashib dam olish kerak!

Internet sohasini oâ€˜rganish bilan shugâ€˜ullanuvchi mutaxassis, mustaqil tadqiqotchi Dmitriy Solovyov internetdan vaqti-vaqti bilan dam olib turish kerakligini olgâ€˜a suradi.  Quyida raqamlar haqiqatdan â€œsoâ€˜zlaydiâ€...
Â 
20 foiz foydalanuvchilar ijtimoiy tarmoqlardan voz kechib, oâ€˜z sahifalarini yopishga qaror qilishgan

2010-yillarda internetdan uzoqlashish urfga kirgan edi. Fransuz yozuvchisi Terri Kruze internetdan yarim yilga, jurnalist Pol Miller esa butun bir yilga voz kechgan ekan. 2020-yilda bunday boâ€˜lishini tasavvur qila olasizmi? Sizga katta muhlatga internetdan uzoqlashing, demoqchi emasmiz. Bor-yoâ€˜gâ€˜i, kuniga bir necha marta faqatgina kerakli bildirishnomalarga eâ€™tibor berish odatini shakllantirishni tavsiya qilmoqchimiz. Shunda siz internetdagi ortiqcha narsalardan yiroqlashgan boâ€˜lasiz.
Â 
67 foiz odamlar telefoniga hech qanday bildirishnoma kelmagan boâ€˜lsa ham uni tinimsiz kuzatishadi

Buning asl sababchisi mikro zerikishdir. Zerikish hissi bir necha soniya yoki butun kun davomida ham kuzatilishi mumkin. Zerikdingizmi, biror bir foydali yumush bilan shugâ€˜ullanishga harakat qiling. Hadeb ijtimoiy tarmoqlarga keraksiz vaqtda ham kirib-chiqaverish, nimalarnidir oâ€˜qishga tushish sizni bora-bora yolgâ€˜izlatib, jamiyatdan alohidalanishga sababchi boâ€˜lishi mumkin.Â 
Â 
10 foiz odamlar oila davrasida oâ€˜tirgan vaqtda ham xabarlarga javob berishda davom etishadi

Raqamli etika hali toâ€˜liq shakllanib ulgurganicha yoâ€˜q. Shu sabab uni har kim oâ€˜zi istaganicha oâ€˜rnatishi mumkin. Biroq dunyodagi eng yaqin insonlaringiz â€“oila qurshovida oâ€˜tirgancha, telefon titkilash tashqaridan ham xunuk koâ€˜rinishini nazarimda, hamma yaxshi biladi.
Â 
The Center of Internet Addictionâ€™da internetdan tobelikni davolashning individual kursi 14000 dollar turadi

Bu yerda internetga qattiq bogâ€˜lanib qolgan insonlar davolanishiga ishonasizmi? Gadjetlar sabab odamlarda stress, surunkali charchoq, asabiylik tobora rivojlanib bormoqda. Raqamli stress bilan ham kurashish kerak.
Â 
65 foiz insonlar birovlar bilan suhbatlasha turib ham telefondan foydalanishadi

Suhbat vaqtida telefon titib, internetdan foydalanib oâ€˜tirish suhbatdoshga nisbatan hurmatsizlik, deb qabul qilinadi. Statistik maâ€™lumotlarga koâ€˜ra, inson qarshisida telefoniga qarab oâ€˜tirgan ikkinchi bir odamning oldida noqulaylikni his qilar ekan. Bu holatda suhbat ikki inson orasida emas, balki ikkita suhbatdosh va suhbatdoshlardan birini dialog vaqtida chalgâ€˜itib oâ€˜tirgan â€œonlayn suhbatdoshâ€ orasida boâ€˜ladi.

Buyuk Britaning 54 foiz aholisi telefonsiz qolib ketishdan qoâ€˜rqadi

Qoâ€˜rquvning bu turi nomofobiya deb ataladi. Bunday fobiyaga duchor boâ€˜lgan odamga telefonni yoâ€˜qotish oâ€˜z tashqi xotirasini, yarim bosh miyasini yoâ€˜qotishdek tuyuladi. Nomofobiyani yana onlayn yaqin insonidan ayrilishdan qoâ€˜rqish, deb ham atashadi.
Â 
Kuniga 150 marta smartfonimizga qaraymiz

Odamlar tun yarmida hojatxonaga chiqishda ham telefoniga qaraydi, undagi xabarga koâ€˜z yugurtiradi. 79 foiz insonlar ertalab uygâ€˜onishlari bilan smartfonidan foydalanishni boshlab yuborishadi. 62 foizi esa darrov ijtimoiy tarmoqlariga kiradi. Erta tongni bu holda qarshi olish toâ€˜gâ€˜ri emas. Bu sizni yalqov va dangasa qilib qoâ€˜yadi. Ushbu odatdan uzoqlashish uchun telefoningizni yotogâ€˜ingizdan uzoqda, boshqa xonada saqlang.
Â 
24 foiz insonlar hayotidagi muhim onlarni telefoniga videoga yoki suratga olishi sabab oâ€˜tkazib yuborishyapti

Onlayn tasvirga olish hayotiy muhim onlardan lazzatlanishingizga toâ€˜qsinlik qiladi. Toâ€˜gâ€˜ri, bu onlarni tarixga muxrlash kerak. Ammo butun bir jarayonni tasvirga olgancha oâ€˜tkazish notoâ€˜gâ€˜ri. Hayot lazzatlariga kamera ortidan qarashni bas qiling!

text.text:
Fayl ochadigan dastur 

ğŸ“‹ Biz tomonimizdan tashkil etilayotgan REPETITSION BLOK TEST ning imtihon kitobchasi TEST BOSHLANGAN VAQTDA elektron shaklda sizga taqdim etiladi.

text: Agar telefoningizda fayl ochadigan dastur (programma) mavjud bo'lmasa, ushbu dasturni yuklab oling.

text.text: Ushbu dastur elektron fayllarni ochadigan android ilova hisoblanadi.

text: Bu orqali fayllarni muammoasiz ochishingiz mumkin.

text.text: Eslatma: Agar siz testlarni kompyuter orqali yechsangiz, ushbu ilovani o'rnatishingiz shart emas.

text_entities.text:
Fayl ochadigan dastur 

ğŸ“‹ Biz tomonimizdan tashkil etilayotgan REPETITSION BLOK TEST ning imtihon kitobchasi TEST BOSHLANGAN VAQTDA elektron shaklda sizga taqdim etiladi.
Agar telefoningizda fayl ochadigan dastur (programma) mavjud bo'lmasa, ushbu dasturni yuklab oling.
Ushbu dastur elektron fayllarni ochadigan android ilova hisoblanadi.
Bu orqali fayllarni muammoasiz ochishingiz mumkin.
Eslatma: Agar siz testlarni kompyuter orqali yechsangiz, ushbu ilovani o'rnatishingiz shart emas.

text.text:
ğŸ¤ Sami Yusuf
ğŸ¼ "Make Me Strong"

I know Iâ€™m waiting
Waiting for something
Something to happen to me
But this waiting comes with
Trials and challenges
Nothing in life is free
I wish that somehow
Youâ€™d tell me out aloud
That on that day Iâ€™ll be ok
But weâ€™ll never know cause
Thatâ€™s not the way it works
Help me find my way

My Lord show me right from wrong
Give me light make me strong
I know the road is long
Make me strong
Sometimes it just gets too much
I feel that Iâ€™ve lost touch
I know the road is long
Make me strong

I know Iâ€™m waiting
Yearning for something
Something known only to me
This waiting comes with
Trials and challenges
Life is one mystery
I wish that somehow
Youâ€™d tell me out aloud
That on that day youâ€™ll forgive me
But weâ€™ll never know cause
Thatâ€™s not the way it works
I beg for your mercy

My Lord show me right from wrong
Give me light make me strong
I know the road is long
Make me strong
Sometimes it just gets too much
I feel that Iâ€™ve lost touch
I know the road is long
Make me strong

text: Jo'jani kuzda sanaydilar, abituriyentlarni esa yozda. Yil davomida o'rgangan bilimlaringizni yoz kelmasdan sinovdan o'tkazishingiz uchun biz ajoyib loyiha boshladik! Eng muhimi, loyihada g'oliblar uchun sovg'alar mavjud!
telegram kanalida abituriyentlar uchun barcha yo'nalishlar bo'yicha onlayn test bo'lib o'tadi.

text.text: Olimpiadada quyidagi yo'nalishdagi eng yangi blok testlar taqdim etiladi:

text.text:
ğŸ–Š 18 - Unit 

The passive 2 

ğŸ”´ The passive ( present continuous, present perfect simple , past continuous, past perfect simple , be going to , modals )
Be in the right from + past participle 

ğŸ”´ Statement 
The pizzas are being .
ğŸ”´ Negative 
The pizza aren't ( are not ) being .
ğŸ”´ Question 
Are the pizza being .

ğŸ”´ Example ( ActiveğŸ”¸ , Passive  ğŸ”¹ )
Present continuous ğŸ”¸ My aunt is doing the washing-up . ğŸ”¹ The washing-up is being done by my aunt .
Present perfect simple ğŸ”¸ My cousion has sent the invitations .ğŸ”¹ The invitations have been sent by my cousion .
Past continuous ğŸ”¸My uncle was cleaning the car .ğŸ”¹ The car was being cleaned by my uncle. 
Past perfect simple ğŸ”¸ Our neighbours had taken the twins to the Zoo. ğŸ”¹ The twins had been taken to the zoo by our neighbors. 
Be going to ğŸ”¸ They're going to invite Phill to the party . ğŸ”¹ Phill is going to be invite to the party .
Modals ğŸ”¸ They might invite Kyle to the party .ğŸ”¹ Kyle might be invited to the party .
ğŸ”¸ We should tell Jenny about the party .ğŸ”¹Jenny should be told about the party .
ğŸ”¸ We must tell Dominic about the concert .ğŸ”¹ Dominic must be told about the concert. 
ğŸ”¸ We can hold the party at Jack's house .ğŸ”¹ the party can be held at Jack's house .

For the passive from of the present simple , past simple and will , se Unit 17.
For the uses of the passive, see Unit 10.

text.text:
â€‹â€‹ğŸ¯ Xushnudbek Xudoyberdiyev Vazirlar Mahkamasiga joriy yilda abituriyentlardan toâ€˜lov olmaslik haqida yaxshi taklif bilan chiqibdi:

Pandemiya sharoitida juda koâ€˜p sohalarda moliyaviy yengilliklar berilmoqda. Sababi oddiy - xalqning daromadlari keskin kamaydi, ayrimlarniki butunlay yoâ€˜qoldi, desak ham boâ€˜ladi. Bunaqa vaziyatda davlat turli moliyaviy koâ€˜mak dasturlarini amalga oshirmoqda.

Xabaringiz bor, oâ€˜tgan yilidan boshlab avvalgi yillarda tugatgan abituriyentlardan test sinovlarida ishtirok etishi uchun yarim "minimalka" miqdorida (101 ming soâ€˜m) toâ€˜lov undirish yoâ€˜lga qoâ€˜yilgan edi. Oâ€˜tgan yili ushbu tizim orqali abituriyentlardan 70 mlrd soâ€˜mdan koâ€˜proq mablagâ€˜ tushgani xabar qilingan edi. 

Joriy yilda bu toâ€˜lov 111,5 ming soâ€˜m boâ€˜ladi. Taxminan 700 ming atrofida "eski abituriyentlar" hujjat topshirishi kutilmoqda.

Biroq aholining iqtisodiy holatini eâ€™tiborga olib, joriy yilda test sinovlari uchun hech qaysi abituriyentlardan toâ€˜lov olmaslikni taklif qilaman.

Xuddi 2019 yilgacha boâ€˜lgani kabi, testlarda qatnashish bepul boâ€˜lishi kerak va kirish sinovlari bilan bogâ€˜liq barcha xarajatlar davlat byudjetidan qoplanishi lozim. Yoâ€˜qsa, hozirgi murakkab sharoitda mana shu 111 ming soâ€˜mni ham topa olmasdan, koâ€˜pchilik yoshlar oâ€˜qishga hujjat topshirish fikridan qaytishi mumkin.

text:
âœ³ï¸ Ingliz tilida ba'zi so'zlar bilan artikl qo'llashning har xil qoidalari mavjud, bu ularning qaysi ma'noda yoki qanday so'z bilan qo'llanayotganiga bog'liq. 

1ï¸âƒ£ very - juda soÊ»zi sifat bilan birlikdagi ot oldidan kelganida uning oldidan noaniq artikl qoÊ»llaniladi. Bu yerda very daraja-miqdor ravishi hisoblanadi. 
ğŸ”¸Bill has bought a very expensive car.

ğŸ”¸You are the very person I need.

2ï¸âƒ£ most - eng degan ma'noda sifatning orttirma darajasini hosil qilganda aniq artikl bilan qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸That was the most boring film I've ever seen.
âš ï¸most soÊ»zi  ba'zan juda (very) degan  ma'noda ham keladi. Bunday hollarda birlikdagi otlar oldidan og'zaki nutqda noaniq artikl  bilan qoÊ»llanishi mumkin.
ğŸ”¸It was a most interesting story.
âš ï¸ most soÊ»zi koÊ»pchilik degan ma'noda ham keladi, bunday holatlarda bu soÊ»z umumiy ma'noda hech qanday artiklsiz qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸âœ–ï¸Most people learn to swim at an early age.

3ï¸âƒ£ Ovqatlanish paytlarini bildiruvchi dinner/lunch/breakfast/supper soÊ»zlari bilan  hech qanday artikl qoÊ»llanilmaydi.
ğŸ”¸Tom has invited me to âœ–ï¸dinner on Thusday.
âš ï¸ Ammo, yuqoridagi soÊ»zlar oldidan sifat qatnashib, tasvirlash qoidasi qo'llanilsa noaniq artikl qoÊ»llaniladi.

ğŸ”¸I usually have a big breakfast.
âš ï¸ Yuqoridagi soÊ»zlar bilan aniqlovchi ibora yoki gap qatnashgan hollarda ular oldidan aniq artikl qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸The dinner we had yesterday was great. (we had yesterday - aniqlovchi gap)

4ï¸âƒ£ Kun paytlarini bildiruvchi dawn/sunrise/sunset/dusk/midnight/night soÊ»zlari at predlogi bilan qoÊ»llanilganda hech qanday artikl qo'llanilmaydi.
âœ… at dawn - erta tongda         
âœ… at sunrise - kun chiqqanda
âœ… at noon -  tushlikda  
âœ… at sunset - kun botganda
âœ… at night - tunda

âš ï¸ morning/afternoon/evening/night soÊ»zlari in predlogi bilan qoÊ»llanilganda odatda  aniq artikl bilan qoÊ»llaniladi.
âœ… in the morning -  ertalab 
âœ… in the afternoon -  tush paytda 
âœ… in the evening - kechqurun
âœ… in the night (during the night) - tunda, tun davomida

âš ï¸ Yuqoridagi soÊ»zlardan oldin sifat va on predlogi kelganda, ular oldidan birlikda noaniq  artikl qoÊ»llanishi mumkin.
âœ… on a rainy morning - yomg'irli tongda 
âœ… on a rainy night - yomg'irli tunda
 
5ï¸âƒ£ Fasllar umumiy ma'noda qoÊ»llanilganda  ular oldidan hech qanday artikl qoÊ»llanilmagani ma'qul.
ğŸ”¸Birds migrate in âœ–ï¸autumn and in âœ–ï¸spring.

âš ï¸Agar joriy yilning yoki biror bir aniq yilning bahori/yozi/kuzi/qishi nazarda tutilgan hollarda fasllar nomlari oldidan aniq artikl  qoÊ»llanadi.
ğŸ”¸The winter was cold this year.
ğŸ”¸I am going to have a long holiday in the summer. (this summer)
âš ï¸ Agar fasllar oldida sifat qatnashgan boÊ»lsa, unda noaniq artikl qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸It was a cold winter.

text:
âœ³ï¸ Ingliz tilida ba'zi so'zlar bilan artikl qo'llashning har xil qoidalari mavjud, bu ularning qaysi ma'noda yoki vazifada qo'llanayotganiga bog'liq. 

1ï¸âƒ£Ingliz tilidagi quyidagi soÊ»zlar oÊ»z vazifasidan kelib chiqib qoÊ»llanilganda hech qanday artikl qoÊ»llanilmasligi lozim.
âœ… university - universitet
âœ… college - kollej
âœ… school - maktab
âœ… prison - turma
âœ… hospital - kasalxona
âœ… church - cherkov
âœ… court - sud 

âœ³ï¸Masalan, quyidagi iboralarda bu soÊ»zlar oÊ»z vazifadan kelib chiqib qoÊ»llangan:  
â–ªï¸go to âœ–ï¸school/âœ–ï¸university/âœ–ï¸college - maktab/universitet/kollejga oÊ»qishga bormoq        
â–ªï¸be at âœ–ï¸school/âœ–ï¸university/âœ–ï¸college - maktab/universitet/kollejda oÊ»qishda boÊ»lmoq
â–ªï¸be in âœ–ï¸prison/be sent to âœ–ï¸prison - jinoyat qilganlik uchun qamoqda boÊ»lmoq/qamoqqa yuborilmoq
â–ªï¸go to âœ–ï¸church - ibodat uchun cherkovga bormoq va hakozolar.
ğŸ”¸ Bill is ill in âœ–ï¸hospital.
ğŸ”¸When I leave âœ–ï¸school, I want to study engineering at âœ–ï¸university.

âš ï¸ Yuqoridagi soÊ»zlar oÊ»z vazifasida emas, bino yoki joy sifatida qoÊ»llanilganda artiklning umumiy qoidasi qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸Excuse me, how can I get to the university? (shahardagi universitet binosi)
ğŸ”¸Sarah is a nurse. She works at the hospital. (kasalxona uning ish joyi)
ğŸ”¸The workmen went to the church to repair the roof. (shahardagi cherkov binosi)

2ï¸âƒ£ work -ish, home - uy, bed - yotoq soÊ»zlari ham odatiy, oÊ»z ma'nosida qoÊ»llanilganda artikl olmaydi. Quyidagi iboralarni yodlab oling:
âœ… be at work
âœ… start work  
âœ… finish work  
âœ… go to work  
âœ… be at  home
âœ… come home
âœ… arrive home
âœ… get home
âœ… go to bed
âœ… in bed
ğŸ”¸I like reading books in âœ–ï¸bed.
ğŸ”¸Is Tom at âœ–ï¸home? No, he is at âœ–ï¸work.

âš ï¸Yuqoridagi soÊ»zlardan bed soÊ»zi krovat (jihoz) sifatida tushunilganda, artiklning umumiy qoidasiga binoan qoÊ»llaniladi .
ğŸ”¸ I enjoy sleeping on a soft bed. (tasvirlash qoidasi)
ğŸ”¸He sat on the bed and began his story. (xonadagi aniq krovat)

3ï¸âƒ£ Musiqa instrumentlari nomlari oldidan, agar ular oÊ»z vazifasida qoÊ»llanilganda, aniq artikl qoÊ»llaniladi.
â–ªï¸the piano/the guitar/the flute/the trumpet
ğŸ”¸ Can you play the piano?

4ï¸âƒ£ Axborot manbasi sifatida radio soÊ»zi aniq artikl, television (TV) soÊ»zi hech qanday artiklsiz qoÊ»llaniladi.
âœ… to listen to the radio - radio tinglamoq
âœ… on the radio - radioda
âœ… to watch TV - televizor koÊ»rmoq 
âœ… on TV - televizorda
ğŸ”¸I enjoy listening to the radio in the evenings.
ğŸ”¸What's on âœ–ï¸TV today?

âš ï¸ Ammo bu otlar jihoz sifatida umumiy qoidaga koÊ»ra qoÊ»llaniladi.
ğŸ”¸Can you turn off the TV? (xonadagi televizor jihozi)

5ï¸âƒ£ Quyidagi soÊ»zlar  the...of+noun birikmalarida aniq artikl bilan qoÊ»llanadi:
â–ªï¸back/beginning/bottom/end/middle/side/top/front
ğŸ”¸There was a table in the middle of the room.
ğŸ”¸We are leaving for London at the beginning of July.

âš ï¸Biroq from âœ–ï¸beginning to âœ–ï¸end - boshidan oxirigacha, in âœ–ï¸front of - oldida iboralari artiklsiz qoÊ»llanadi.

2ï¸âƒ£ work -ish, home - uy, bed - yotoq soÊ»zlari ham odatiy, oÊ»z ma'nosida qoÊ»llanilganda artikl olmaydi. Quyidagi iboralarni yodlab oling:

text.text: Kirish imtihonlari testlari qay darajada soddalashtiriladi?
2020-2021-oâ€˜quv yili uchun oâ€˜tkaziladigan test sinovlarida test topshiriqlari boâ€˜yicha oâ€˜zgarishlar

text:
Davlat test markazi tomonidan test topshiriqlarini soddalashtirish, abituriyentlarga yengillik va qulayliklar yaratish yuzasidan bir qator ishlar amalga oshirilmoqda.

Jumladan, 2020-2021-oâ€˜quv yili uchun oâ€˜tkaziladigan oliy taâ€™lim muassasalarining bakalavriatiga kirish test sinovlarida test topshiriqlari boâ€˜yicha quyidagi oâ€˜zgarishlarni amalga oshirish rejalashtirilmoqda.
Â 
âœ…

ğŸ‘‰ Test topshiriqlari soddalashtiriladi deganda oliy taâ€™lim muassasalarining bakalavriatiga qabul imtihonlarida faqat sodda testlardan foydalaniladi, deb tushunmaslik kerak.

ğŸ‘‰ Umumtaâ€™lim fanlaridan test topshiriqlari 3 ta qiyinlik darajasida shakllantiriladi. Bunda birinchi qiyinlik darajasidagi test topshiriqlar ishlanishi, bajarilishi oson boâ€˜lgan test topshiriqlari hisoblanadi.

ğŸ‘‰ Avvalgi yillarda oâ€˜tkazilgan test sinovlarida fanlardan 6 tagacha birinchi qiyinlik darajasidagi test topshiriqlari berilar edi. Joriy yildaÂ har bir variantda qoâ€˜llaniladigan birinchi qiyinlik darajasidagi test topshiriqlari soni oâ€˜rtacha 10 tagacha yetkazilmoqda.
Â 
âœ…

text.text: Yozuvsiz xarita, jadval, rasmli koâ€˜rinishidagi test topshiriqlari sonini koâ€˜paytirish:

text:
ğŸ‘‰ Abituriyentlar test topshiriqlarini mantiqiy fikrlab, tezda tushunishlari uchun joriy yilda ham tarix, geografiya fanlari kabi chet tili (ingliz, nemis, fransuz) fanlaridan ham rasmli test topshiriqlari shakllantirilmoqda. Shuningdek, biologiya va kimyo fanlaridan rasmli test topshiriqlari soni koâ€˜paytirilmoqda.Â 

âœ…

text.text: Ona tili va adabiyot fanidan test topshiriqlarini soddalashtirish:

text:
ğŸ‘‰ Ona tili (oâ€˜zbek, rus, qoraqalpoq) va adabiyot fanidan mustaqil oâ€˜qish uchun tavsiya qilingan badiiy asarlardan test topshiriqlari soni koâ€˜paytiriladi. 

ğŸ‘‰ Shuningdek, abituriyentlarning mantiqiy fikrlashini rivojlantirish maqsadida matnli testlar, yaâ€™ni matn ustida ishlash bilan bogâ€˜liq boâ€˜lgan test topshiriqlari tuzilmoqda.

ğŸ‘‰ Matnli test topshiriqlarida matn tarkibidagi soâ€˜zlarning toâ€˜gâ€˜ri qoâ€˜llanganligini va gaplarning toâ€˜gâ€˜ri shakllantirilganligini aniqlash, matndagi soâ€˜zlarning maâ€™nolarini topish va matnning asosiy mazmunini tushunish talab etiladi.

âœ…

text.text: Kimyo va fizika fanidan nazariy test topshiriqlari sonini oshirish:

text:
ğŸ‘‰ Kimyo fanidan nazariy test topshiriqlar soni oshiriladi va laboratoriya ishlariga oid test topshiriqlari tuzilmoqda.

ğŸ‘‰ Fizika fanidan ham nazariy test topshiriqlar soni oshirilgan holda birinchi qiyinlik darajasidagi test topshiriqlari soni 6 tadan 10 tagacha koâ€˜paytirilmoqda.

ğŸ‘‰ Shuningdek, abituriyentlarga qulaylik yaratish maqsadida â€œDoimiy fizik kattaliklar jadvaliâ€ ishlab chiqildi va u â€œKimyoviy elementlar davriy sistemasiâ€ kabi test sinovi topshirish jarayonida abituriyentlarga taqdim etiladi.

text.text:
Â© Davlat test markazi matbuot xizmati

Batafsil ma'lumotğŸ‘‡

text.text:
Assalomu alaykum kanalimiz obunachilari. Kanalimizda konkurs o'tkazmaganga ham ancha vaqt bo'ldi. Shuni inobatga olib kanalimizda konkurs o'tkazmoqchimiz. Online Testga halaqit bermasligi uchun
konkursni
kanalimizda o'tkazmoqchimiz. Siz konkursda ishtirok etish uchun
ga o'zingizga yoqqan rasmni jo'natasiz va admin uni

kanaliga obuna bo'lishi shart. Siz kanalizmizga do'stlarizni taklif qilib like yig'ishingiz kerak bo'ladi. Konkurs 10 kun davomi etadi. 31-May kuni g'liblar aniqlanadi va kanalda e'lon qilinadi. G'oliblar uchun sovg'alar:

ğŸ¥‡10 kunlik treningda bepul ishtirok etish
ğŸ¥ˆ10 kunlik treningda 50% chegirma asosida ishtirok etish
ğŸ¥‰10 kunlik treningda 30% chegirma asosida ishtirok etish
Rasmlarni qabul qilish bugun soat 12:00 da boshlanadi. Rasmlarni

text.text:
Rasmiy xabar
ğŸ“‹ Maktablarda oâ€˜quv yili yakunidagi imtihonlar bekor qilinadi!

"Prezidentimiz tomonidan karantin vaqtida aholiga imkon boricha qoâ€˜shimcha qulaylik yaratish boâ€˜yicha belgilangan vazifani amalga oshirish hamda koâ€˜pchilik ota-onalarning iltimoslarini inobatga olib, bu oâ€˜quv yili yakunidagi imtihonlarni bekor qilamiz. 
 
Maktablarga oâ€˜quvchilarning yillik baholarini istisno tariqasida joriy oâ€˜quv yilining 3 ta chorak baholari asosida chiqarish tavsiya etiladi. Shu bilan birgalikda

tizimi joriy etilgan maktablarda karantin vaqtida tirishqoqlik bilan oâ€˜qigan oâ€˜quvchilarimizga ragâ€˜batlantirish sifatida 4-chorakdagi faqat ijobiy baholarini ham yillik baholarini hisoblashda inobatga olish tavsiya etiladi.

Karantin vaqtida Â«online-maktabÂ» orqali farzandlari bilan birga dars tayyorlagan barcha ota-onalarga oâ€˜z minnatdorchiligimizni bildiramiz

messages.title: Love Yourself

messages.from: Online English lessons and Japanese language
messages.author: íƒœ ë¬¼ ë°± ì„œ ë¹„ ëŸ½
messages.text:
Justin Bieber
"Love Yourself"

For all the times that you rain on my parade
And all the clubs you get in using my name
You think you broke my heart, oh, girl for goodness' sake
You think I'm crying on my own. Well, I ain't

And I didn't wanna write a song
'Cause I didn't want anyone thinking I still care. I don't
But you still hit my phone up
And, baby, I'll be movin' on
And I think you should be somethin' I don't wanna hold back
Maybe you should know that

My mama don't like you and she likes everyone
And I never like to admit that I was wrong
And I've been so caught up in my job
Didn't see what's going on
But now I know
I'm better sleeping on my own

'Cause if you like the way you look that much
Oh, baby, you should go and love yourself
And if you think that I'm still holdin' on to somethin'
You should go and love yourself

And when you told me that you hated my friends
The only problem was with you and not them
And every time you told me my opinion was wrong
And tried to make me forget where I came from

And I didn't wanna write a song
'Cause I didn't want anyone thinking I still care. I don't
But you still hit my phone up
And, baby, I'll be movin' on
And I think you should be somethin' I don't wanna hold back
Maybe you should know that

My mama don't like you and she likes everyone
And I never like to admit that I was wrong
And I've been so caught up in my job
Didn't see what's going on
But now I know
I'm better sleeping on my own

'Cause if you like the way you look that much
Oh, baby, you should go and love yourself
And if you think that I'm still holdin' on to somethin'
You should go and love yourself

For all the times that you made me feel small
I fell in love. Now I feel nothin' at all
And never felt so low when I was vulnerable
Was I a fool to let you break down my walls?

'Cause if you like the way you look that much
Oh, baby, you should go and love yourself
And if you think that I'm still holdin' on to somethin'
You should go and love yourself

'Cause if you like the way you look that much
Oh, baby, you should go and love yourself
And if you think (you think) that I'm (that I'm) still holdin' on (holdin' on) to somethin'
You should go and love yourself

text.text: O'zbekistonda â€œSo'nggi qo'ng'iroqâ€ning onlayn-translyatsiyasi tashkil etiladi

text:
Koronavirus pandemiyasi munosabati bilan umumta'lim maktablari o'quvchilari uchun darslar onlayn tarzda o'tkazilmoqda. Karantin talablariga ko'ra bu yil maktablarda â€œSo'nggi qo'ng'iroqâ€ tadbirlari o'tkazilmaydigan bo'ldi. Bu esa bitiruvchilarning kayfiyatiga salbiy ta'sir etishi mumkin. Chunki maktab bilan xayrlashuv tadbiri bir umr insonning xotirasida saqlanib qoladigan holatlardan biridir.

O'quvchilarning kayfiyatini ko'tarish va ularga yoqimli xotiralar taqdim etish maqsadida UZREPORT TV Xalq ta'limi vazirligi va Toshkent shahar hokimligi bilan hamkorlikda â€œSo'nggi qo'ng'iroqâ€ onlayn loyihasini tashkil qilishga qaror qildi. 

â€œSo'nggi qo'ng'iroqâ€ onlayn tadbirida maktab direktorlari, o'qituvchilar va ota-onalar bitiruvchilarni bayram bilan onlayn tarzda tabriklashadi. Shuningdek, bitiruvchilarning o'zlari ham jonli efirda o'z do'stlari va ustozlariga tilaklar bildirish imkoniga ega bo'lishadi. Ijtimoiy tarmoqlardagi o'z postlarida

xeshtegidan foydalangan holda har bir inson ushbu bayramga qo'shilishi mumkin. 

Va albatta tadbir nihoyasida so'nggi qo'ng'iroq jiringlab, â€œXayr, maktabimâ€ qo'shig'i birgalikda kuylanadi.

text.text: â€œSo'nggi qo'ng'iroq - bitiruvchilar va ularning oilalari doimo orziqib kutadigan an'anadir. Mavjud vaziyat tufayli biz oâ€˜quvchilarni qo'llab-quvvatlashga qaror qildik, shu sababli, mazkur tadbirni onlayn ravishda tashkil etmoqdamiz. Umid qilamizki, bu tadbir maktab o'quvchilari uchun an'anaviy bayramning ajoyib muqobili bo'lib, katta hayotga qadam qoâ€˜yayotgan yoshlarga pozitiv kayfiyat baxsh etadiâ€, - dedi UZREPORT TV bosh muharriri birinchi o'rinbosari Alisher Azimov.
Tadbirni 25 may kuni soat 08:30 da UZREPORT TV da hamda telekanalning
â€™dagi sahifalari orqali jonli efirda tomosha qilish mumkin.

text:
Lyrics of memories!

Here's to the ones that we got
Cheers to the wish you were here, but you're not
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories
Of everything we've been through
Toast to the ones here today
Toast to the ones that we lost on the way
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories
And the memories bring back, memories bring back you
There's a time that I remember, when I did not know no pain
When I believed in forever, and everything would stay the same
Now my heart feel like December when somebody say your name
'Cause I can't reach out to call you, but I know I will one day, yeah
Everybody hurts sometimes
Everybody hurts someday, ayy ayy
But everything gon' be alright
Go and raise a glass and say, ayy
Here's to the ones that we got
Cheers to the wish you were here, but you're not
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories
Of everything we've been through
Toast to the ones here today
Toast to the ones that we lost on the way
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories
And the memories bring back, memories bring back you
Doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo
Memories bring back, memories bring back you
There's a time that I remember when I never felt so lost
When I felt all of the hatred was too powerful to stop (ooh, yeah)
Now my heart feel like an ember and it's lighting up the dark
I'll carry these torches for ya that you know I'll never drop, yeah
Everybody hurts sometimes
Everybody hurts someday, ayy ayy
But everything gon' be alright
Go and raise a glass and say, ayy
Here's to the ones that we got (oh)
Cheers to the wish you were here, but you're not
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories
Of everything we've been through (no, no)
Toast to the ones here today (ayy)
Toast to the ones that we lost on the way
'Cause the drinks bring back all the memories (ayy)
And the memories bring back, memories bring back you
Doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo
Memories bring back, memories bring back you
Doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo, doo doo doo (ooh, yeah)
Memories bring back, memories bring back you
Yeah, yeah, yeah
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, doh, doh

text:
I should've known
I'd leave alone
Just goes to show
That the blood you bleedÂ 
Is just the blood you owe

We were a pair
But I saw you there
Too much to bear
You were my life
But life is far away from fair

Was I stupid to love you?
